review: This is the one of best place in tangalla eat seafood. I was eat tuna it was really good. I really enjoyed my time..

I stayed for one week in Anus house and I felt like home! Beautiful selfmade furniture, a paradise garden and free access to the kitchen. I took the bike and also got the possibility to rent the scooter, Anu made incredible coconut pancakes and knew...some nice secret spots to watch the sunset on the beach or a good fish restaurant. I really thank him for all his effort and the lovely ti some nice secret spots to watch the sunset on the beach or a good fish restaurant. I really thank him for all his effort and the lovely time.

A great place by the ocean. Spacious, with comfortable seats, with a huge swing overlooking the ocean and small ones by the bar. The food is delicious, fresh, prepared on the spot. There were 10 us and every dish was absolutely amazing. The tuna from...the starter and mango salasa took me to ciusine paradise. Music just make you dance. And the Owner: he makes everything the place is exceptional for the ambience, gives you personal touch, tries to have a small talk with everyone and makes you feel more than just a plain client. What a god blessed place! Fantastic food meets an unbelievable view on Tangalles Sunset. The prawns where extremely tasty and fresh like just jumped out of the ocean. Very nice bar restaurant for afternoon or evening 
Seafood restaurant (we tried the lobster and it was perfect), chilled ambiance, nice view for sunset, next to a nice beach 
I do recommend

We ate here 3 times during our stay in Tangalle and the food was unbelievable. Me and my girlfriend didnâ€™t enjoy the food in Sri Lanka but The Lounge was the first time we had a good meal. The owner is a bit of a...loose cannon as you can see from the reviews but if you want a good meal by the beach, you have to come here. Another recommendation not just for the Lounge, but all bars in Sri Lanka would be to install a good quality dartboard with real darts. We had a great night at the Lounge. As we walked along the beach from our accommodation, we werenâ€™t overly impressed with the options available for dinner. We then spoke to someone who recommended the Lounge and we were delighted that we followed their advice!...You get a barge across the water with nice views and awesome beach-bar atmosphere.

It was a Friday night so we got to see a traditional dance and fire show which was awesome, and had the seafood pasta and some delicious cocktails!

Highly recomme You get a barge across the water with nice views and awesome beach-bar atmosphere.

Highly recommend!

Top place, do not miss! Super friendly owner Gihan and great chef and staff. The menu is imaginative and a welcome twist on local cuisine. If youâ€™re around Friday night thereâ€™s a party with Sri Lankan dancers. They also have a great pool table!
The food was amazing, the setting beautiful and the staff very friendly. The pull-boat to get there was a bonus! Good music too...

We had the best mahi-mahi on this island so far. It came with mashed potato - and even that was excellent! The tuna as a starter was also high standard! This is a very relaxed place - very "western/latin style - more expensive than other...places around here, but definetly worth the money. We will eat there aga places around here, but definetly worth the money. We will eat there again!

Great food and ambience spoiled by the owner threatening us with violence (no joke) as we tried to pay.

The sad thing is it was the best food we have had on our trip in Sri Lanka and I wanted to leave an amazing review....When we went to pay he said there is a 3% surcharge for using a card.

I asked why he didn't tell us before - his response was this is standard for Sri Lanka. I told him in 2 weeks of being here we have NEVER been asked to pay a surcharge. 

He wanted cash (in my experience people who want cash do so to avoid tax) and claimed his machine wasn't working.  It was working fine but if it wasn't shouldn't he have told us from the beginning?).

He then threw the cards at us and said 'if you don't want to pay you won't leave here. If you want trouble I will give you trouble-.

 This is a clear threat of violence and in the UK would constitute a criminal offence). We were NOT not going to pay, we were chatting quite normally (the owner had been very chatty with us when we arrived) so I was shocked he threatened us. 

If you want great food with a genuine threat of violence then this is your place. A GREAT evening (the best in our two weeks) spoiled in 2 minutes. I would avoid this pla When we went to pay he said there is a 3% surcharge for using a card.

If you want great food with a genuine threat of violence then this is your place. A GREAT evening (the best in our two weeks) spoiled in 2 minutes. I would avoid this place.
Very good food. I am not your casual fish eater, but the fish here was delicious!  You will be brought by a raft to a very nice location at the sea! Great view over sea, and the staff is very kind!
Excellent food, very nice people, fabulous setting by the sea. We discovered by accident, returned once, will probably return again during our stay in Tangalle. Thank you so much!

This experience was the most enjoyable restaurant visit of my three week Sri Lankan vacation.

It is owned by an extremely loveable gentleman who was beyond accomodating and ensured that me and my friends enjoyed our night.

And if youâ€™re wanting to eat some high...quality fresh seafood, just go here and simply ask for the tuna sashimi. You will struggle to find anything as good!

Just trust me
Reallly romantic place to see the sun go down. The chef is really passioned about the food and you can taste that! We had faboulus tuna. The best we had in Sri Lanka
